intro: Xanthisma pseudorestiforme, commonly known as the false restifolium, is a rare and specialized plant species native to the arid regions of southwestern China. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous root system adapted to nutrient-poor soils. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy habitats, showcasing a compact growth form to minimize water loss. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, providing additional protection against desiccation. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, Xanthisma pseudorestiforme is considered a valuable subject for botanical research on adaptation to extreme environments.
